attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2020-0067

Date: 2020-02-06

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, fixes the remuneration, in the amount and on the date indicated in the annexed schedule, of:

 

Barnes, Donald Paul, former President and Chief Executive Officer of Marine Atlantic Inc., within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Beckel, Margaret Louise, Director of the Canadian Museum of Nature, within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Brault, Simon, O.C., O.Q., Director of the Canada Council for the Arts, within the range CEO 4 ($226,000 - $265,800), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Carlin, Glen Patrick, former Chief Executive Officer of The Jacques-Cartier and Champlain Bridges Inc., within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), commencing on April 1, 2018 and ending on October 19, 2018;

 

Chapman, Marie, Director of the Canadian Museum of Immigration at Pier 21, within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Cosman, Dean A., former President and Chief Executive Officer of the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, within the range ($271,000 - $317,800), commencing on June 19, 2018 and ending on November 11, 2018;

 

Daignault, Benoit, former President and Chief Executive Officer of Export Development Canada, within the range CEO 6 ($325,300 - $382,700), effective January 1, 2019;

 

 

 

 

 

…/2


- 2 -

Goldstein, David F., former President of the Canadian Tourism Commission, within the range CEO 4 ($226,000 - $265,800), effective January 1, 2019;

 

Griffiths, Sean, Chief Executive Officer of the Atlantic Pilotage Authority, within the range CEO 2 ($157,200 - $184,900), effective January 1, 2019;

 

Guay, Chantal, Executive Director of the Standards Council of Canada, within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Hanington, Sandra, former Master of the Mint, within the range ($325,300 - $381,700), commencing on January 1, 2018 and ending on July 1, 2018;

 

Hoffort, Michael, President and Chief Executive Officer of Farm Credit Canada, within the range CEO 5 ($271,000 - $318,800), effective April 1, 2019;

Juneau, André, former interim Chief Executive Officer of the Windsor-Detroit Bridge Authority, within the range CEO 4 ($226,000 - $265,800), commencing on April 1, 2018 and ending on July 15, 2018;

 

Lebel, Jean, President of the International Development Research Centre, within the range CEO 4 ($226,000 - $265,800), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Lemire, Robert F., former Chief Executive Officer of the Great Lakes Pilotage Authority, within the range CEO 2 ($157,200 - $184,900), commencing on January 1, 2018 and ending on December 31, 2018;

 

Ma, Lilian Yan Yan, Executive Director of the Canadian Race Relations Foundation, within the range CEO 1 ($131,200 - $154,300), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Martel, Sandra, Chief Executive Officer of The Jacques-Cartier and Champlain Bridges Inc., within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Mayer, Marc, former Director of the National Gallery of Canada, within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), commencing on April 1, 2018 and ending on January 18, 2019;

 

McBain, John, President and Chief Executive Officer of Canada Lands Company Limited, within the range CEO 4 ($226,000 - $265,800), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Obermeyer, Kevin, Chief Executive Officer of the Pacific Pilotage Authority, within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective January 1, 2019;

 

O’Neill, Mark, Director of the Canadian Museum of History, within the range CEO 4 ($226,000 - $265,800), effective April 1, 2019;

 

Paul, James Stewart, former President and Chief Executive Officer of Defence Construction (1951) Limited, within the range CEO 3 ($188,500 - $221,700), effective April 1, 2019;

Sur recommandation du premier ministre, Son Excellence la Gouverneure générale en conseil fixe la rémunération, conformément au montant et à la date indiqués dans l’annexe ci-jointe, de :

 

Barnes, Donald Paul, ancien président et premier dirigeant de Marine Atlantique S.C.C., dans l’échelle CEO 3 (188 500 $ – 221 700 $), à compter du 1er avril 2019;

 

Beckel, Margaret Louise, directrice du Musée canadien de la nature, dans l’échelle CEO 3 (188 500 $ – 221 700 $), à compter du 1er avril 2019;

 

Brault, Simon, O.C., O.Q., directeur du Conseil des Arts du Canada, dans l’échelle CEO 4 (226 000 $ – 265 800 $), à compter du 1er avril 2019;

 

Carlin, Glen Patrick, ancien premier dirigeant de la société Les Ponts Jacques-Cartier et Champlain Inc., dans l’échelle CEO 3 (188 500 $ – 221 700 $), commençant le 1er avril 2018 et se terminant le 19 octobre 2018;

 

Chapman, Marie, directrice du Musée canadien de l’immigration du Quai 21, dans l’échelle CEO 3 (188 500 $ – 221 700 $), à compter du 1er avril 2019;

 

Cosman, Dean A., ancien président et premier dirigeant de la Société d’assurance-dépôts du Canada, dans l’échelle
(271 000 $ – 317 800 $), commençant le 19 juin 2018 et se terminant le 11 novembre 2018;

 

Daignault, Benoit, ancien président et chef de la direction d’Exportation et développement Canada, dans l’échelle CEO 6 (325 300 $ – 382 700 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2019;

(226 000 $ – 265 800 $), à compter du 1er janvier 2019;

Hoffort, Michael, président et premier dirigeant de Financement agricole Canada, dans l’échelle CEO 5 (271 000 $ – 318 800 $), à compter du 1er avril 2019;
